author: rays5439
content: Thanks, just to make sure I understand it correctly, "exit" means the validator wants to stop its node and withdraw the minimum 32 eth? And withdrawal of this 32 eth has to happen during these exits?

author: pietjepuk
content:
If you want to exit, you broadcast a message of the sort. Then you get put in the exit queue. You still have active attestation duties while in the queue. Once your validator has exited you no longer have attestation duties, but still have to wait 27 hours before your 32 ETH becomes withdrawable.

If you have 0x01 withdrawal credentials (an address), the withdrawal will happen automatically when it's your turn in the (partial _and_ full) withdrawal processing loop, this can take a few days. If you have 0x00 withdrawal credentials (a hash of a BLS withdrawal pubkey), you will be skipped over, and your balance stays as-is.
